it.polimi.se2018.view.gui

Class JavaFxDisplayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • it.polimi.se2018.view.gui.JavaFxDisplayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Displayer

    public class JavaFxDisplayer
extends javafx.application.Application
implements Displayer
    This class displays the game using a JavaFX gui.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void askConfirm()
      Asks the user to confirm the usage of a tool card.
      void askDiceToSwap()
      Changes the event pack of the game board to allow the user to swap one die from the round track with one from the draft pool.
      void askDifficulty()
      Asks, in SinglePlayer mode, the difficulty of the game.
      void askIncrement()
      Asks the user to choose if increment or decrement the value of a die.
      void askPattern()
      Shows to the player a set of patterns to allow him to decide which one to use during the game.
      void askPlacement()
      Asks the user to place a die.
      void askPrivateObjective()
      Asks, at the end of the game, which PrivateObjectiveCard he wants to use to calculate the score on his final Pattern.
      void askValueDestination()
      Changes the event pack of the game board to allow the user to choose die value and place it on its pattern.
      boolean displayConfirm(java.lang.String text)
      Asks the user if he wants to confirm the choice he made.
      void displayError(java.lang.String error)
      Shows on the screen if there were errors during the game.
      void displayLoginView()
      Displays the login view, where the usere must insert it's username and choose the type of connection and the game mode (multi-player or single-player).
      void displayMultiPlayerGame()
      Displays a game board for multi player mode.
      void displayScoreBoard()
      Loads and displays the score board.
      void displaySinglePlayerGame()
      Displays a game for single player mode.

      The getter for the ViewDataOrganizer of the view.

        public void askDifficulty()
        Asks, in SinglePlayer mode, the difficulty of the game. Depending on the difficulty a certain number of cards will be given to the player, to be used during the game.
